member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.CachedSchemaRegistryClient.CleanCacheIfFull
member.remarks:
This is to make sure memory doesn't explode in the case of incorrect usage.
It's behavior is pretty extreme - remove everything and start again if the cache gets full. However, in practical situations this is not expected.
TODO: Implement an LRU Cache here or something instead.

member.summary: The subject the schema is registered against.

member.summary: Unique identifier of the schema.

member.summary: A string representation of the schema.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Schema class.
member.param: The subject the schema is registered against.
The schema version, >= 0
The globally unique identifier of the schema, >= 0
String representation of the schema.

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the Schema object.
member.returns: A string that represents the schema object.

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema.GetHashCode
member.summary: Returns a hash code for this Schema.
member.returns: An integer that specifies a hash value for this Schema.

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema.CompareTo(Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema)
member.summary: Compares this instance with a specified Schema object and indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or appears in the same position in the sort order as the specified schema.
member.param: The schema to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that indicates whether this instance precedes, follows, or appears in the same position in the sort order as the other parameter. Less than zero: this instance precedes other. Zero: this instance has the same position in the sort order as other. Greater than zero: This instance follows other OR other is null.

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance and a specified object, which must also be a Schema object, have the same value (Overrides Object.Equals(Object))
member.param: The Schema to compare to this instance.
member.returns: true if obj is a Schema and its value is the same as this instance; otherwise, false. If obj is null, the method returns false.

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema.Equals(Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Schema)
member.summary: Determines whether this instance and another specified Schema object are the same.
member.param: The schema to compare to this instance.
member.returns: true if the value of the other parameter is the same as the value of this instance; otherwise, false. If other is null, the method returns false.

member.remarks: It may be useful to expose this publicly, but this is not required by the Avro serializers, so we will keep this internal for now to minimize documentation / risk of API change etc.

member.summary: The index of the last client successfully used (or random if none worked).

member.summary: HttpClient instances corresponding to each provided schema registry Uri.

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.RestService.RequestAsync``1(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.Object[])
member.remarks: Used for end points that return a json object { ... }

member.name: M:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.RestService.RequestListOfAsync``1(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.Object[])
member.remarks: Used for end points that return a json array [ ... ]

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.Versions.GenericRequest
member.remarks: This type is completely generic and carries no actual information about the type of data, but it is the default for request entities if no content type is specified. Well behaving users of the API will always specify the content type, but ad hoc use may omit it. We treat this as JSON since that's all we currently support.

member.name: T:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.AuthCredentialsSource
member.summary: Auth credentials source.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.AuthCredentialsSource.UserInfo
member.summary: Credentials are specified via the `schema.registry.basic.auth.user.info` config property in the form username:password. If `schema.registry.basic.auth.user.info` is not set, authentication is disabled.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.AuthCredentialsSource.SaslInherit
member.summary: Credentials are specified via the `sasl.username` and `sasl.password` configuration properties.

member.name: T:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SubjectNameStrategy
member.summary: Subject name strategy. Refer to: https://www.confluent.io/blog/put-several-event-types-kafka-topic/

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SubjectNameStrategy.Topic
member.summary: (default): The subject name for message keys is <topic>-key, and <topic>-value for message values. This means that the schemas of all messages in the topic must be compatible with each other.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SubjectNameStrategy.Record
member.summary: The subject name is the fully-qualified name of the Avro record type of the message. Thus, the schema registry checks the compatibility for a particular record type, regardless of topic. This setting allows any number of different event types in the same topic.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SubjectNameStrategy.TopicRecord
member.summary: The subject name is <topic>-<type>, where <topic> is the Kafka topic name, and <type> is the fully-qualified name of the Avro record type of the message. This setting also allows any number of event types in the same topic, and further constrains the compatibility check to the current topic only.

member.name: T:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig
member.summary: configuration properties.

member.name: T:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames
member.summary: Configuration property names specific to the schema registry client.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryUrl
member.summary: A comma-separated list of URLs for schema registry instances that are used to register or lookup schemas.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryRequestTimeoutMs
member.summary:
Specifies the timeout for requests to Confluent Schema Registry.
default: 30000

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryMaxCachedSchemas
member.summary:
Specifies the maximum number of schemas CachedSchemaRegistryClient should cache locally.
default: 1000

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryBasicAuthCredentialsSource
member.summary:
Specifies the configuration property(ies) that provide the basic authentication credentials. USER_INFO: Credentials are specified via the `schema.registry.basic.auth.user.info` config property in the form username:password. If `schema.registry.basic.auth.user.info` is not set, authentication is disabled. SASL_INHERIT: Credentials are specified via the `sasl.username` and `sasl.password` configuration properties.
default: USER_INFO

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryBasicAuthUserInfo
member.summary:
Basic auth credentials in the form {username}:{password}.
default: "" (no authentication).

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryKeySubjectNameStrategy
member.summary: Key subject name strategy.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SchemaRegistryValueSubjectNameStrategy
member.summary: Value subject name strategy.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SslCaLocation
member.summary: File path to CA certificate(s) for verifying the schema registry's key.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SslCertificateLocation
member.summary: Ssl certificate location.

member.name: F:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.PropertyNames.SslCertificatePassword
member.summary: Ssl certificate password.

member.summary: Specifies the configuration property(ies) that provide the basic authentication credentials.

member.summary: A comma-separated list of URLs for schema registry instances that are used to register or lookup schemas.

member.summary: A comma-separated list of URLs for schema registry instances that are used to register or lookup schemas.

member.name: P:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.RequestTimeoutMs
member.summary:
Specifies the timeout for requests to Confluent Schema Registry.
default: 30000

member.name: P:Confluent.SchemaRegistry.SchemaRegistryConfig.SslCaLocation
member.summary:
File or directory path to CA certificate(s) for verifying the schema registry's key.

member.summary:

default: '' importance: low

member.summary:

member.summary:
